intro: Dioscorea crotalariifolia, commonly known as the horned yam, is a perennial vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its distinctive,戟-shaped (spear-like) leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by tuberous roots that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit involves climbing stems that can reach several meters in length. The botanical features of D. crotalariifolia make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
